# Complete YAML Reference

This page provides a comprehensive reference for all the configuration options available in the YAML frontmatter of your `.qmd` file.

## Document Metadata

### `title`
The main title for the generated PDF.
**Type:** String

### `author`
A nested object for personal details.
**Fields:**
*   `firstname`: Your first name.
*   `lastname`: Your last name.
*   `contact`: List of contact objects (`icon`, `text`, `url`).
*   `socialmedia`: List of social media objects.

### `position`
Displayed on the Title Page.
**Type:** String

### `profile-photo`
Path relative to project root. Set to `null` to disable.
**Type:** String

### `aboutme`
Short bio.
**Type:** String

## Cover Letter

### `recipient`
Recipient details (`name`, `salutation`, `address`, `city`, `zip`).

### `date` / `subject`
Strings for the letter.

## Data Integration (`google-document`)

Configures the Google Sheet connection.

**Fields:**
*   `auth-email`: Email for authentication.
*   `document-identifier`: Sheet Name or ID.
*   `sheets-to-load`: List of sheets mapping `name` (Tab Name) to `shortname` (ID).

## Publication List (`publication-list`)

**Fields:**
*   `bib_file`: Path to bibliography file(s).
*   `bib_style`: Path to CSL file.
*   `author_name`: Name to highlight (e.g., "Doe, J.").
*   `default_label`: Label for uncategorized items (default: "Other").
*   `group_labels`: Map of types to labels.
    *   Types must follow Pandoc convention (e.g., `article`, `book`, `conference`).
    *   Example: `article: "Journal Papers"`.
*   `group_order`: A list defining the display order of groups.
    *   **Indexing:** You can use `Name=Index` syntax to fix positions.
    *   Example: `["Journal Article=1", "Book=3", "Other"]`. This puts Journals 1st, Books 3rd, and fills "Other" in the remaining slots (2nd).

## Output Options

### `render-output`
`"cv-only"`, `"letter-only"`, or `"combined"`.

### `attachments`
List of `{name, file}` objects to append as pages.

### `style`
*   `color-accent`: Hex code.
*   `font-header` / `font-text`: Font names.
